page.title: 19THE CHURCH OF FOREST TOWN
page.content: {THE CHURCH OF ST.ALBANS}WAS BUILT IN 1911 WITH MONEY DONATED BY THE DUKE OF PORTLAND.THE CHURCH OCCUPIES A CENTRAL POSITION IN THE VILLAGE OF FOREST TOWN AND WAS ERECTED PRIMARILY TO SERVE THE SPIRITUAL NEEDS OF THE LOCAL MINERS WHO HAD MOVED INTO THE AREA TO WORK AT THE NEW PIT. WITH THE OPENING OF CROWN FARM PIT ACCOMMODATION WAS ALSO PROVIDED,SET OUT IN 9 AVENUES,THE FIRST TWO ESPECI_ ALLY FOR THE DEPUTIES.THE CHURCH WAS INTERWOVEN INTO THE VILLAGE LIFE AS IT WAS EXPECTED THAT MINERS WOULD ATTEND SERVICES OR ELSE LOSE PAY. THE PLACE OF THE CHURCH IN THE SOCIETY HAS CHANGED OVER THE YEARS,WITH THE CONGREGATION OF 80 BEING THE SAME NUMBER AS THAT OF 30 YEARS AGO.THE GRAVE YARD STILL OFFERS PLOTS FOR BURIAL FOR THE NEXT 30 YEARS WHILE MANY OTHER CHURCH GROUNDS ARE FULL.
